Uses of Class
org.marc4j.marc.DataField

  • Packages that use DataField 
    Package Description
    org.marc4j.marc
    This package contains a record object model to store and edit MARC records or parts of records as objects.

    • Uses of DataField in org.marc4j.marc

      Methods in org.marc4j.marc that return DataField 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static DataField DataField.copy​(DataField original)
      Creates a copy of the original instance without copy the id attribute.
      DataField Record.getDataField​(String tag)
      Deprecated.
      Use Record.getFirstDataField(String)
      DataField Record.getFirstDataField​(String tag)
      Returns the first data field for the given tag.
      Methods in org.marc4j.marc that return types with arguments of type DataField 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      List<DataField> Record.getDataFieldList()
      Deprecated.
      Use Record.getDataFields()
      List<DataField> Record.getDataFields()
      Returns the collection of data fields.
      Stream<DataField> Record.getDataFieldsStream()
      Returns a stream of the data fields of this record
      Stream<DataField> Record.getDataFieldsStream​(String tag)
      Returns a stream of the data fields of this record, that have the indicated tag
      Stream<DataField> Record.getDataFieldsStreamPrefixedBy​(String tagPrefix)
      Returns a stream of the data fields of this record, that have the indicated tag or are prefixed by a tag value
      Methods in org.marc4j.marc with parameters of type DataField 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void Record.add​(DataField field)
      Adds a new DataField instance to the collection of variable fields.
      static DataField DataField.copy​(DataField original)
      Creates a copy of the original instance without copy the id attribute.
      Method parameters in org.marc4j.marc with type arguments of type DataField 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void Record.setDataFieldList​(List<DataField> newList)
      Deprecated.
      Use #setDataFields(List)
      void Record.setDataFields​(Collection<DataField> newDataFields)
      Sets the collection of data fields.
      Constructors in org.marc4j.marc with parameters of type DataField 
      Constructor Description
      DataField​(DataField other)
      Copy constructor Copy id attribute, so if you don't want has the same, use copy(DataField).
